title: How did fish survive before they had gills? - Quora

response.answer_text: Were there fish before they had gills? Animals without specialized respiratory structures carry out gas exchange directly through the skin (e.g., earthworms.) This puts definite limits on size (surface : volume ratio), activity, etc. Gills are believed to pre-date fish as a group.
Fish ALWAYS had gills, or something very like them, until amphibians evolved lungs (and even they have gills until they mature into adults). Jeez, what DO they teach in junior high school these days?
